messages.message: hey team, any idea why I keep getting these emails? it's been consistently a few dozen/day over the last week or so
dont know why but I've gotten these too. this has helped preserve my sanity
yeah I was there was a day to unsubscribe from Jenkins directly, I wasn't able to see a way to do that though :confused: that approach ^ might be the next best thing

it looks like its a google group <mailto:instabase-ci-status@instabase.com|instabase-ci-status@instabase.com> that we're all a part of. you can try unsubscribing like this, but not sure if there are other (important) emails that are supposed to come through here

all of eng@ is subscribed to the test failures. you don’t want to unsubscribe to that otherwise you will lose access to a lot of  things (Github, jenkins) and all the important emails. this looks like someone added the product@ mailing list under eng@.

@Hari @Kerry how useful is the golden-test failure email to the instabase-ci group? is it still use it to triage the flakey goldens? if we remove the email, you lose some logs since jenkins doesn’t preserve logs for very long.

@Heymian Emails are redundant nowadays. We have constant eyes on the channel and a mechanism to tag owners. Removing email will also remove the clutter from the jenkins console log. I will ask Aayush to disable the email compilation part from the golden script. Is there anything we need to do to disable this in the Jenkins pipeline?
yes please. I think you just remove the email part of the pipeline. @shiqi can confirm
sorry! that was me - i added product@ to eng@ when i was tranfering groups from workplace - @Heymian please feel free to remove
yeah probably want to keep them separate Grace, a lot of permissions are tied to those two groups
@Seth mystery resolved for your email questions as well :)
